verses.roman:
mā bhaiṣṭety abhayārāvau
śāla-hastau tarasvinau
āsedatus taṁ tarasā
tvaritaṁ guhyakādhamam

synonyms: mā bhaiṣṭa—do not fear; iti—thus calling; abhaya—giving fearlessness; ārāvau—whose words; śāla—stones; hastau—in Their hands; tarasvinau—moving quickly; āsedatuḥ—They approached; tam—that demon; tarasā—with haste; tvaritam—who was moving swiftly; guhyaka—of Yakṣas; adhamam—the worst.
translation: The Lords called out in reply, "Do not fear! "Then They picked up logs of the śala tree and quickly pursued that lowest of Guhyakas, who swiftly ran away.
